intro: Hieracium argutifolium, commonly known as the hooked hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and often hairy. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, producing yellow flowers that attract various pollinators. Hieracium argutifolium is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, demonstrating adaptability to a range of environmental conditions.
